Java: Java doesn't have this feature  although a similar effect is possible with the <kbd>Optional</kbd> class <source lang=Java> var a = Optional.of(42); var b = Optional.empty(); // orElse(0) returns 0 if the value of b is null var c = a.get() * b.orElse(0); </source>
C#: <source lang=CSharp> int? a = 42; int? b = null; // c will receive the null value // because*is lifted and one of the operands are null int? c = a * b; </source>
